get.summary: Get the status of a manage audience members request.

audienceId.description: An integer value representing the Amazon audience identifier. This is the identifier that is returned during audience creation.

clientId.description: The identifier of a client associated with a "Login with Amazon" account.

ipAddress.description: A String value holding an ipAddress used to determine country for members in this audience. Optional.

description.description: The audience description. Must be an alphanumeric, non-null string between 0 to 1000 characters in length.

name.description: The audience name. Must be an alphanumeric string between 10 to 128 characters in length.

AmcpLinkUnauthorizedRequestExceptionResp.description: Unauthorized. The request failed because the user is not authenticated or is not allowed to invoke the operation.

advertiserId.description: An identifier for a targeted resource.

audienceId.description: A number value representing the Amazon audience identifier. This is the identifier that is returned during audience creation.

description.description: The audience description. Must be an alphanumeric, non-null string between 0 to 1000 characters in length.

name.description: The audience name. Must be an alphanumeric string between 10 to 128 characters in length.

audienceFees.description: A list of currency keys and costs per impressions (CPM)

ttl.description: Time-to-live in seconds. The amount of time the record is associated with the audience.

agreementContent.description: The terms and conditions agreement content.

agreementToken.description: The terms and conditions agreement token. Required to accept an agreement.

hasAccepted.description: Flag indicating whether the Customer has accepted the AMC Terms and Conditions.

jobRequestId.description: Unique identifier for job request generated at the server side when an audience records are uploaded . When `POST` method is invoked to upload audience records, a unique identifier is returned.

audienceFees.description: A list of currency keys and costs per impressions (CPM)

ttl.description: Time-to-live in seconds. The amount of time the record is associated with the audience.

AmcpLinkResourceNotFoundExceptionRespons.description: Not Found. The requested resource does not exist or is not visible for the user.

recordsProcessedRate.description: Percent of records submitted that were successfully processed without errors.

targetType.description: This specifies one or more targets.

AmcpLinkGetConnectionsV2ResponseContent.description: List of Partner Connections with an Advertiser's AMC Instances and DSP Advertisers.

DataCollaborationJobNotFoundExceptionRes.description: The requested job was not found.

AmcpLinkTooManyRequestsExceptionResponse.description: Too Many Requests. The request was rate-limited. Retry later.

dspAudienceSize.description: The count of records in DSP audience.

idResolutionCount.description: The number of matched records during id resolution.

receivedRecordSize.description: The number of records received by ADSP.

cpmCents.description: Cost per thousand impressions (CPM) in cents. For example, $1.00 = 100 cents.

agreementToken.description: The terms and conditions agreement token.

hasAccepted.description: Flag indicating whether the Customer has accepted the AMC Terms and Conditions. Submitting true will set the customer as having accepted the terms and conditions.

audienceId.description: A number value representing the Amazon audience identifier. This is the identifier that is returned during audience creation.

countryCode.description: A String value representing ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code for the members in this audience. Optional.

externalUserId.description: This is an external user identifier defined by data providers.

hashedPII.description: List of hashed personally-identifiable information records to be matched with Amazon identities for future use. All inputs must be properly normalized and SHA-256 hashed.

connectionId.description: An unique identifier for the connection. This will be auto-generated if not provided in the request.

isDefault.description: Flag indicating if this is the Default Connection for this Customer who is creating the Connection. The system will ensure to have at least 1 default connection.

CountryCode.description: Country Code. Two letter ISO 3166-1 alpha-2

gpp.description: A field to hold a 'Global Privacy Platform (GPP)' string. Optional.

tcf.description: A field to hold the 'Transparency and Consent Framework (TCF)' string. Optional.

AmcpLinkForbiddenRequestExceptionRespons.description: Forbidden. The request failed because the user does not have access to the specified resource.

advertiserId.description: An identifier for a targeted resource.

audienceId.description: A number value representing the Amazon audience identifier. This is the identifier that is returned during audience creation.

countryCode.description: A String value representing ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code for the members in this audience. Optional.

description.description: The audience description. Must be an alphanumeric, non-null string between 0 to 1000 characters in length.

name.description: The audience name. Must be an alphanumeric string between 10 to 128 characters in length.

connectionId.description: Identifier of the connection that was created.

audienceFees.description: A list of currency keys and costs per impressions (CPM)

ttl.description: Time-to-live in seconds. The amount of time the record is associated with the audience.

connectionId.description: Connection between Partner and Advertiser. If blank or not provided then the default active connection is used.

targetTypes.description: List of included upload paths.  AMC is always included in this by default

AmcpLinkServerExceptionResponseContent.description: Internal server error. Retry later. Contact support if this response persists.

description.description: The audience description. Must be an alphanumeric, non-null string between 0 to 1000 characters in length.

TargetResourceMetadata.description: The identifier of the target resource. It can either be a connectionId or advertiserId.

audienceId.description: An number value representing the Amazon audience identifier. This is the identifier that is returned during audience creation.
